Description: Semi circular artificial eye in stone with a black round dot to mark the iris located on the top half of the piece. Object is fragmentary with missing left end. The piece is flat, slightly thicker on the top, with a smooth edge. Black deposit visible at the back (and only small one visible on the front), with other light brown stains visible throughout. The front view is nicely polished, while tool marks are visible at the back. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (2nd row, 2nd from the right of fig. 1)
